main event: Mrs. Doris Gentry observed a bright, circular, metallic-appearing object hovering silently over a field in Stoughton, Wisconsin on the evening of March 20, 1967.
interesting points: The object was approximately 30 feet in diameter and hovered about 40 to 50 feet above the ground for about 15 minutes before moving rapidly to the northeast and disappearing., The object made no sound and left no exhaust or trail., Mrs. Gentry called her neighbors to come and watch the object with her., The object impressed Mrs. Gentry as unusual and not of this world., There were no other witnesses apart from Mrs. Gentry, as her neighbors did not report seeing anything unusual.
witness description: Mrs. Doris Gentry, a widow living alone
